DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._The type of a material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes. This includes particular types of cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory substances.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The type of a material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes. This includes particular types of cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory substances.

Concepts.definition: The type of a material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes. This includes particular types of cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory substances.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/1/10 released DEC per direction of model owner as part of caDSR model cleanup activity.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A storage facility of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins. The biorepository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage, and documentation of biological specimens.

Concepts.definition: A storage facility of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins. The biorepository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage, and documentation of biological specimens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An eicosanoid and biologically inactive metabolite of thromboxane A2. Thromboxane B2 is released during anaphylaxis. As thromboxane A2 has a short half-life, the levels of thromboxane B2 can be used to indirectly measure the production of thromboxane A2.

Concepts.definition: An eicosanoid and biologically inactive metabolite of thromboxane A2. Thromboxane B2 is released during anaphylaxis. As thromboxane A2 has a short half-life, the levels of thromboxane B2 can be used to indirectly measure the production of thromboxane A2

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.: This gene plays a role in immune and inflammatory processes.

Concepts.definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.
This gene plays a role in immune and inflammatory processes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA, that is 20-25 nucleotides in length, which is transcribed from DNA but is not translated into a protein. This nucleic acid may regulate the transcription or translation of other genes.

Concepts.definition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA, that is 20-25 nucleotides in length, which is transcribed from DNA but is not translated into a protein. This nucleic acid may regulate the transcription or translation of other genes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
